intro: Dipcadi oligotrichum, commonly known as the slender tunicate, is a member of the family Podostomata, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. It is characterized by its small, ribbon-like leaves that are often submerged in water. The plant lacks true roots and instead has specialized structures called rhizoids that anchor it to submerged surfaces. It thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, such as streams and rivers. Its reproductive structures are borne on the leaves, and it plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms.
